required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of SCT-I10A in Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II, Multicenter, Single-arm, Open-label Study of SCT-I10A in Patients With Recurrent/ Metastatic Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma Who Progressed on or After Platinum-based Chemotherapy

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of SCT-I10A for Recurrent/ Metastatic Head and Neck Squamous cell Carcinoma who progressed on or after platinum-based chemotherapy

detailed_description.textblock: This is an open label, single-arm and multicenter phase II study designed to evaluate Objective Response Rate (ORR) of SCT-I10A for Recurrent/ Metastatic Head and Neck Squamous cell Carcinoma who progressed on or after platinum-based chemotherapy.

primary_outcome.description: ORR is defined as proportion of patients achieving complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) according to RECIST v1.1 during trial treatment

clinical_study.condition: Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma

arm_group.description: SCT-I10A, 200 mg intravenous (IV) on Day 1 of each 3-week cycle.

intervention.description: SCT-I10A, 200 mg intravenous (IV) on Day 1 of each 3-week cycle.

overall_official.affiliation: Cancer Institute and Hospital, Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences

facility.name: Guangxi Medical University Affiliated Tumour Hospital

condition_browse.mesh_term: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of Head and Neck
